website_summaries.verdict: An engaging trivia game that is a top pick for groups and multiple ages.
pros: Users love how fun, creative, and interesting this trivia game is
Many felt it was the ideal trivia game for groups, and the questions had a good level of challenge but were still appropriate for multiple ages
It also gets top marks for how easy it is to learn how to play
cons: Some felt the cost was a bit too high, and occasionally reviewers received damaged pieces, so quality control could be improved

customer_reviews.title: This is great improvement over the old version!  This is a FUN game for ALL ages!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great improvement over the old version. Our family (grandparents, parents and kids) all liked the old version but we love this version. All ages are on a level playing field and that makes the game a GREAT one for us! The deluxe version is not worth the doubling of the price. We wanted to have more people playing so I made an extra score card, bought some dry erase markers and now many more can play at the same time. Fun Fun Fun
customer_reviews.author: The Giz

customer_reviews.title: Combines Trivia Kniwledge and Betting Strategies
customer_reviews.text: Great things about this game: 1. Not a "sit around a lot and wait your turn" type of game. Everyone writes answers at the same time, places bets at the same time, etc. 2. Not a "Trivial Pursuit" type of trivia game. Some answers you may know, some you may not. What you lack in trivia skills you can make up for in betting skills and vice versa. 3. Easy for kids to play. All answers are in number form (weight, year, number etc)
customer_reviews.author: Sadie

customer_reviews.title: Do you want to be correct or do you want to win?
customer_reviews.text: We bought the original game a while ago. This is one of the games that is replayed when we get a gathering. Everyone enjoys the game play. Surprisingly, the tactics and strategy required to win are more complex that initially thought. A person who is behind can start making some interesting guesses and bets to skew the odds in their favor. Being correct may not be the best course of action on every turn. Very much enjoy playing this. We had to add higher denominations to our set to accommodate the action within our group.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Great game, but running out of play
customer_reviews.text: Everyone loves this game, kids 6, 15, 17, hubby, and myself can all play together and have just about the same chance of winning. Closest thing I have to pleasing everybody on game night. Running out of cards, though, and we probably only have another round or two before we're done. Would like to see expansion packs or something so we can keep playing, otherwise once we've answered everything, we're done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn and play, fun for all - loved by those who hate other games
customer_reviews.text: Wits & Wagers is a great game for someone that doesn't like most games because they aren't good at strategy - simple game play and easy for children and challenging for adults. Great for putting everyone on an even playing field regardless of knowledge or strategy skill level. Another game that also does this is called "Gobblet Gobblers", it looks like simple tic tac toe but it is not simple. Gobblet Gobblers is the only game I have seen where a 5 year old can beat an adult who is trying to win!
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great game- I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: We've used this game for over a year now- whenever we have people over, family or friends, they all seem to like it a lot and have a lot of fun. It is a great icebreaker and is fairly easy to figure out how to use and play. People who have visited us several times still like playing it- it makes for good conversation and you don't have to be a brainiac to figure it out and win a few rounds. I definitely recommend it- well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect party game for the entire family
customer_reviews.text: Wits and Wagers is a great trivia game, whether you are good at trivia or not. Players answer questions that most people couldn't answer - How many people attended the World's Fair in 1920?, for example. The answer is always in the form of a number. Players then show their answers, place them in order in the middle, and then pick which answer they believe to be the closest, without going over. You score based on if you guessed correctly, or if you gave the closest answer. Anyone can play and everyone will love it!
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have Board Game!
customer_reviews.text: This might be my favorite board game, it's easily on my top 5 favorite board games list. Very easy to play, great for all ages. I like this game so much that I have purchased all the question cards form the North Star Games website, and I also purchased the Vegas Expansion (which I aslo highly recommend).
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kwon

customer_reviews.title: and the idea of betting in a party-trivia game is fun, ultimately no one we played with seemed very ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a game where your knowledge is not tested, but your ability to guess (which of course, is random). Though the concept is strong, and the idea of betting in a party-trivia game is fun, ultimately no one we played with seemed very focused on the stakes or very interested in the questions, they were merely baffling. Might be fun with teams, but we'll have to wait and see.
customer_reviews.author: Dante Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: I used this game several times as a work morale event and everyone absolutely loved it. Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Some of the answers are questioable as the answers they are going off of were years ago. However, I used this game several times as a work morale event and everyone absolutely loved it. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: K Tippett

customer_reviews.title: GREAT gift!
customer_reviews.text: my 10 year old got this for his bday from my mom and he LOVES it! we like to play the adult version or wits and wagers and he just can't realistically "guess" answers to that one. so this family style wits and wagers REALLY is meant for family and is great for both kids and adults! typically, when games say "family" it's really geared towards kids and kinda easy/boring for the adults. not this one! I'm very happy with this game and we get to learn while having fun!
customer_reviews.author: Fancy Pants

customer_reviews.title: Nice updated version
customer_reviews.text: This is a very fun game, and works great with a larger group. Bought this as an update to an earlier edition as the questions get stale after a few years. I was disappointed that this version has 2 questions per card per side. My older version has 7, which allowed more play without getting a repeat question.
customer_reviews.author: P. Stoeger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Game
customer_reviews.text: Played this at a recent party where we had people from age 10-75. We had about 15 people playing so divided into teams. Absolutely everyone loved this game! Easy to learn. I wish the answer boards were a little more durable - after one night a couple of them had quite a bit of wear and tear - depending on the enthusiasm of the people on that team. It's a great game and several people asked where I found it - I was happy to tell them.
customer_reviews.author: FrugalNut

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Kids liked it and played it several times but they said it is just OK since it really becomes a glorified guessing game. They said it's fun but I notice this isn't their first pick.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Family fun
customer_reviews.text: Love this game... this is easy to play for all ages. Great trivia game that the family can play. My husband can’t hear great, and usually doesn’t enjoy games, bc he never hears the questions & games time out but with this game, everyone has the same opportunity to answer!! Great fun, lots of laughs
customer_reviews.author: Lora Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: and we had so much fun! You don't need any special knowledge or skills ...
customer_reviews.text: Five of us played this game, and we had so much fun! You don't need any special knowledge or skills to play, yet it's really a blast to guess and wager. A question is asked, you write down your answer, all the answers are put in order, and then you bet on whose answer is closest to the correct answer without going over. It's very engaging for a group. (As a point of reference, we are all college-educated, some with advanced degrees, and we love playing games of all types, especially card games and strategy board games.)
customer_reviews.author: OKshopper

customer_reviews.title: New improved version has fewer questions
customer_reviews.text: All the older youtube demonstration videos show that there are seven questions per card. Mine came with only two questions per card. very disappointing considering the price. Why not provide the seven question cards especially if you buy the deluxe edition? It appears than after selling a million games they decided to provide only 250 questions. In fairest they did make improvements to the playing pieces and kept the same price. However I would have paid a little more to have additional questions.
customer_reviews.author: Kajillion

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Family Game
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after hearing an ad on the radio for it. Our family thoroughly enjoys it on game night. We have played it with kids age 7 on up through with the grandparents. It's not super complex to play, but offers a nice competition that everyone can enjoy AND most importantly put the phones and tablets away and be social for a bit. One full game takes about 15-20 minutes to play. We usually play 2-3x when we sit down to play We're not all the way through the cards yet so no issues there with us at this time.
customer_reviews.author: DonkeyChewingAWaffle

customer_reviews.title: Fun party game - great deluxe edition!
customer_reviews.text: This is our new favorite small group game. We have only every played it with 1 person per color. It is low pressure because you don't actually have to know anything, you just need to know who to bet on and how to play the spread. This deluxe version has a very nice felt mat, and nice real poker chips for your two color chips. The pens all have eraser tips so we don't have to hand out paper towels to everyone. I wish the other "chips" were also poker chips, but I understand that would increase the cost. There are only 2 questions per card vs. 5 in the older version we had.
customer_reviews.author: Ckels

customer_reviews.title: Fun Group Game
customer_reviews.text: This game is a great game for a small group playing individually or a bigger group of people playing in teams. It is quick to learn and fun for a broad age span. Perfect for family get togethers. This game wasn't available when I first went to order it off Amazon, but they ended up restocking it and I ended up getting it for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: All About Books

customer_reviews.title: Not new!!
customer_reviews.text: Was sent as the box and damaged. You can tell as well it’s been repackaged. It doesn’t have original packaging. IT also claims to be new which is clearly not the case. would only give one star except that I had paid half price and as far as I know have the pieces to at least play the game.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not fun - slow and tedious
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I’d played the party version once. This version is not fun. At all. You are only supposed to read seven questions before the game is over. Tallying the wins is a bit tedious. My family didn’t want to play again after the first time. I imagine it’ll end up donated to a thrift store.
customer_reviews.author: Art Collector

customer_reviews.title: Wide age range and interest can play
customer_reviews.text: We had this out over the holidays. Our age range was 10-50 and we all had a great time. Even went for 2nd and 3rd go arounds. Very interesting to see how much people know and was great for guesstimating numbers...questions regarding the average height, length, width or weight of different things, number of spots on a cartoon character, number of occurrences of different things...completely random which made it fun for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: BMDavis

customer_reviews.title: Great Family Fun
customer_reviews.text: Excellent game! We played this with family after Christmas dinner. We had an age range of 12 to 43, and everyone could play. All of the answers are numbers, so you need some intelligent people with good trivia skills. The teenagers actually knew more than a well-educated man with a master's degree. :) This is definitely a game for groups of people with varied skill levels.
customer_reviews.author: sunmom2

customer_reviews.title: Great family game!
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty fun, simple, and quick game to play. They've simplified it somewhat from the regular version to be easier for kids to play, but so far we've played it with adults/teens, and it doesn't "feel" like a kids game...good for the whole family... probably middle elementary on up. It is fast to explain...just play one demo round in a few minutes and everyone will understand the rules.
customer_reviews.author: H. Bussell

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all
customer_reviews.text: My family loved this game.. all ages could play. The questions were a tad tough but that is what made it fun. My mom actually took the game home to play at game night in her Sr, housing and my 27 year old son wants to use it for his next party. Success in my mind.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Piper

customer_reviews.title: A simple yet fun game for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: Played this at Christmas with my entire family, ages 7 through 65. Everyone loved it! I do wish it was possible to have more players, but we doubled-up and it ended up being just as much fun playing in teams of 2! This game is simple enough to understand and explain to new players, but it's complex enough that it doesn't get boring quickly. Each round ended up taking about 20-30 mins to play so it wasn't too long & drawn out either. We're a family of board gamers so this was a very fun addition to our collection!
customer_reviews.author: bananawest

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Watched it played on YouTube Northstar games. Watched a version played on Table top before I bought it. It is a great. Fun for large gatherings. I played with 6 other people and it was fun! This will be my go to game for more that 4 people.
customer_reviews.author: Reddog911

customer_reviews.title: So much fun and a game the whole family can play!
customer_reviews.text: Super fun game and suitable at a family party for all ages. My brother and his wife turned me onto this game. I bought the higher end version that had fancier betting chips (non cardboard...more durable like authentic poker chips).
customer_reviews.author: Indigo Girl

customer_reviews.title: So fun and you learn some things too.
customer_reviews.text: It is a great family game. The last time we played my 8 year old grandson played too. He did great so it is great for 8 and up. I even got my 92 year old mother-in-law to play. It is loads of fun. Great game to learn new facts.
customer_reviews.author: weightlosschamp

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why it's won so many awards
customer_reviews.text: It's nothing but trivia with numerical answers. It boring and repetitive. We (ages 10-86) played and none of us really enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Best game for hosting large groups!
customer_reviews.text: One of the most fun and best party games we have ever played. We host a lot of group parties and this game is easy to learn and a lot of fun to play. The questions are witty and fun and very few people ever know the actual answer. There is enough questions (250) that people can't easily remember the answers after going through all the cards. The only downside is if you have more than 7 players you have to start making groups.
customer_reviews.author: A Little Bit Of Everything

customer_reviews.title: Great questions, play for the answers
customer_reviews.text: This game is so much fun! After awhile we stopped the "betting" and just asked the questions, the answers were so FUNNY. Great for adults and children. We played at a company Christmas party and bought one to play at home.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Original is better
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun game but I actually like the original version better. They should have just put out more question cards and called it good. If you like the first one you may as well buy this one but just forewarning it's like movie sequels...they're never as good as the original! LOL
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Nice game - but we play for money to make it spicy!
customer_reviews.text: We got this game for xmas and played it right away. It is simple to learn and can be fun. But it does get a bit boring after a while. If you have a good memory (like my family seems to have) you can't use the cards again because we all remember the answer. To spice things up we decided to play for money, and that made it more interesting. Not that I encourage gambling! But this is a easy party game that sparks conversation. A nice game.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten SH

customer_reviews.title: Fun, Fun, and More Fun.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this game for my family to play while they were in town during the Thanksgiving holidays. It was an instant hit. I loved the fact that education level, race, upbringing, work industry, etc. was not a prerequisite to winning this game. There were several degrees in the room and we all we stumped on some of the questions. It left us all wanting more. We played several games while they were here and I have a feeling I will be asked to bring it the next time we all get together. This is a great game. It even humbled some people. Great for family get togethers.
customer_reviews.author: K. McGuire

customer_reviews.title: This is our second version and we love this game
customer_reviews.text: This is always a hit at our house or at parties. Game is so simple that young kids can play and it only takes a minute to set up and you can go as long as you want. This is one of our most favorite games out of about 100 that we own.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: 3 Dud Markers out of 5
customer_reviews.text: The markers were dry out of thw box after unwrapping the present when we went to play christmas morning, so we had to take turns on writing down the answers. The game itself is ok when played with a family of 4 adults and 12 yo and 8 yo. The knowledge difference is great and the 8 yo is just learning to grasp to wager with the person most likely to know the answer. I think it might be more fun when played with a peer group.
customer_reviews.author: carmoucm

customer_reviews.title: Our new favorite!
customer_reviews.text: This is our new favorite game-night game! We have played this with a group of adults as well as on family night with our kids and had so much fun each time. 6 year old was a bit iffy and got a bit bored, but I’m betting 8+ will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Hartnell

customer_reviews.title: Fun Trivia with a Twist
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy playing this game. It's a fun game that allows people who aren't super good at trivia to stay competitive in the game. Also, the questions are really cool. I also like the sheer number of questions this game includes. Even if you get through all of them, the answers are usually numbers so unless one of them really sticks in your mind, you probably won't remember the question.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great family fun for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: We just started playing this a few weeks ago, and we are addicted. At first, we were concerned it wouldnt be as fun as the non-family edition, since the betting in this game was slightly different than the betting in the non-family version. But, after playing a few rounds, we fell in love with it. We realized this betting style makes it easier for any age to play. We are a family of 5 (our kids are ages 6,10, and 11). All 5 of us enjoy this game tremendously. It has quickly become our favorite game to play on family game night!
customer_reviews.author: B. Karan

customer_reviews.title: Best older family game
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun game, we play several times a year at my mothers, and had to have our own game. Its definitely for middle school aged and up. But its a family game and very easy to understand the rules. This version was updated and slightly different then my moms older version which had 7 questions in a 'game'. This seems to have no end, maybe we read the instructions wrong but the game and questions are fun and exciting. We play often!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley H.

customer_reviews.title: Great guessing trivia game
customer_reviews.text: We really like this game. It is really fun. If you have more people playing then what you have cards for, just pair up and be partners. My kids are pretty good at this game because they've read a lot of Guinness world record books oh, so there is a hint for you if you want to win the game!
customer_reviews.author: K. Stahl

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: After a long travel day and a bunch of exhausted adults we opened this game to appease the kids who were pestering us to play something. Thankfully the directions were super easy to understand and we were up and playing in minutes. Everyone from 7 to 70 had a great time even those who claimed the didn't like "board games". Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer HTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: I Bet You'll Love this Game
customer_reviews.text: What an easy and fun game! I purchased this last Christmas for our family Christmas Eve game night, and everyone enjoyed it. The directions are easy to understand and follow. Three generations play--preteens to seniors (senior citizens, that is). (I did not receive any compensation for this review. I purchased the game on my own.)
customer_reviews.author: Lynn B. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Great Game!!
customer_reviews.text: We got this game for Christmas and have played with adults and kids. Everyone loves playing. Lots of laughter and conversation while your play. Although we've gone through the questions once or twice, it's hard to remember the answers. No one feels intimidated because it's a guessing game and anyone can make a guess. When will more questions be available to add on?
customer_reviews.author: hv2005

customer_reviews.title: This is such a fun game! I'm always looking for wide age range ...
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fun game! I'm always looking for wide age range games that will still keep the interest of my young adult children so we can play a family game together. This was a blast and we are looking forward to playing again soon. The fun part was that even if your guess was way off, you still had another chance to wager on another person's guess. Kept us interested! Just not sure how it will be when we've used up all the question cards. Have not found any add-on sets so far.
customer_reviews.author: CAMom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to play, easy to learn, all ages 5-90 years! GREAT FAMILY GAME!
customer_reviews.text: Great game for all ages! Bought as a gift for a family with 2 kids (boy 8 and girl 12.) Played with a large group ages 8 to 64 years old. Super fun everyone enjoyed. Pros: Game takes about 20 minutes to play, 5-8 minutes to learn, easy, any age can win. Had some great conversation's about the questions and answers. Educational trivia. Con: Best 4- 6 people but we played in teams of 2 (9p total) so worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: D.  Carey

customer_reviews.title: Fun for All Ages
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this game as a gift for my grandchildren. The whole family had so much fun with it, that I purchased another game to play with friends.
customer_reviews.author: kb1

customer_reviews.title: It’s fun when played with more than 4 people
customer_reviews.text: We played this game with our neighbors and it was a lot of fun so we decided to get one. If you’re too serious and trying to get it right it ain’t fun.
customer_reviews.author: Michael & Na’ama Devivo

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping and very fun game for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: I am always skeptical of purchasing games without playing them first becasue I have three children ages, 5, 10 and-14 years old. So it is difficult to get a game we all can enjoy. This ones the one though! It is fun for our 5 year old and for my teenager as well as myself and my husband. My 5 year old may not understand everything about guessing the number to the question but he has won on his own without help! The price was reasonable and shipping was very fast.
customer_reviews.author: LilDini

customer_reviews.title: All ages entertainment
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this game. Gave it to friends for Xmas 10 yrs ago and now they are moving; immediately bought it again to have at my house. Super fun! I enjoy the trivia of it, but it also works for people that need a bit of gambling to stay entertained. Fun for all ages!
customer_reviews.author: Meg C.

customer_reviews.title: ... board game with a friend's family and fell in love. I've played it now a couple of times ...
customer_reviews.text: I played this board game with a friend's family and fell in love. I've played it now a couple of times with different groups of people (even people who traditionally don't like board games), and it's always been a hit. What's cool about it is that you really don't need to know trivia to win b/c of the gambling aspect so everyone can get involved and feel like they have a shot at winning.
customer_reviews.author: MN Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Wits and Wagers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for family gatherings and it can be played with a few or as teams. Everyone enjoys this game and you can end when you want. Everyone had fun and learned something. IE. How many hot dogs are eaten per person per year? You guess and the winner not going over the number wins.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Good family game for ages 8-adult
customer_reviews.text: Played this with our 8yr old grandson and his parents. It’s a little like trivial pursuit but you guess answers and it’s not exact, so we had lots of fun and learned stuff to.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl D.

customer_reviews.title: Looked like fun and something my kids would enjoy doing
customer_reviews.text: I saw this game on Wil Wheaton's Tabletob youtube channel. Looked like fun and something my kids would enjoy doing. They love it! Game play is easy to explain in a few minutes so it worked well for a social gathering we went to. Downside of this version as mentioned in some other reviews, this has no erasers on the end the markers. Not a star breaker. This was my kids first exposure to meeples in a game, they had fun just trying to remember the name meeples, much like when we played Farkle. Also a fun game that you only really need 6 dice for.
customer_reviews.author: James Mccrory

customer_reviews.title: It's obvious why this game has won so many awards!
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun game! Be prepared to laugh yourself silly! It does help to have competitive people in your group, but even if you don't, the answers alone will be enough to send you and your family (or friends) into a fit of giggles! Of course, once the "high-stakes" players came in, the game became even more exciting and hilarious! We can definitely understand why this game has won so many awards! Highly recommend it for family game night or for a great way to entertain friends :)
customer_reviews.author: E. Littlefield

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for the game being fun and easy to learn. I am returning this because it was shipped just the box with a rubber band around it...
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Randel

customer_reviews.title: Laughing so hard with this game
customer_reviews.text: We've been able to play this game several times with our guests, even kids of any age who can write numbers. It's so fun and we always end up laughing our heads off because of some of the hilarious answers. Even grandparents love playing this game. It's as easy as sitting down with a dry erase marker and writing numbers of any sort on the card. The better your are at guessing, the faster you can win. Our son who doesn't know the difference between 2 and infinity won because he guessed right. Great game! It's so easy to explain so anyone can play.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Mel

customer_reviews.title: Not like the family version.
customer_reviews.text: We previously bought the Family version. We loved this version it as it was simple to score and for children to understand. We thought the deluxe was a way to get a new set of questions but it was almost a totally different game and much harder to score and bet. It seemed that many of the questions were the same as in the family version. If you want simplicity the family version is best at a much better price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game for adult evenings or family nights
customer_reviews.text: Even if you have no idea of the answer someone you are playing with does. This means that every time you can still potentially get the correct answer and win. Great for family nights and adult evenings. We have played this a lot!
customer_reviews.author: AWin617

customer_reviews.title: love this version
customer_reviews.text: love this version. also got the family version for my nieces and nephew but did not like it. the kids like this version better
customer_reviews.author: ajwong

customer_reviews.title: Super fun game.
customer_reviews.text: This is a super fun game! You should really play with 6 or more people to really get it going! I first played this at a friends house and came home and had to order it to have at home. It is LOADS of fun! You won't be sorry. Great party game!
customer_reviews.author: E. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Fun even for non trivia folks
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about finding a party game for a group because some people are fact and trivia buffs and some aren't. The nice thing about this one is that you could bet smart on people that you thought knew things and still do well, even if you aren't that good at trivia. The only strange thing is that the cards have non sequitur statements next to the answers. Example, a question was asked about how many women participated in a particular Olympic competition. The answer was given and then some other random fact about that game was given, but nothing related, such as which events the women participated in. It would be more interesting to expand upon the answer...
customer_reviews.author: S. Holeman

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for a large group!
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun for a large group. We bought multiple different editions but usually use the child cards because the other ones are too hard of questions so then it's just mostly luck.
customer_reviews.author: Havit-please

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Fun for the adults too
customer_reviews.text: I own and play the first version frequently. Even non-gamers love it. This family version stands up to the standard adult version. The questions are a little sillier but still super fun for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: J Miller

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game!
customer_reviews.text: A fun game for all ages (or at least anyone who is old enough to read and write numbers). If you have more than 5 players, you can play as a team. It's sure to bring a few laughs to your gathering!
customer_reviews.author: Clemson Grad!

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up on the recommendation of a friend. I'm very happy that I got the game. The family loves this game. My 10 year old likes it as much as my 15 year old. It's a lot of fun and just because you don't know the answer doesn't mean you can't put your number on the board. There is one thin that's poorly done on this game. The holder for the question card is a piece of junk. It's thin plastic and isn't built to allow access to the cards. I've had the game for just a couple of days and have already thrown that holder away.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S. in MD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game, but the Deluxe version is not an ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome game, but the Deluxe version is not an upgrade. It has less less questions than the older version. Deluxe has nicer chips but that doesn't matter to me.
customer_reviews.author: Asia H

customer_reviews.title: My kids are now 16 and we still enjoy playing this game
customer_reviews.text: My kids are now 16 and we still enjoy playing this game. The players are asked questions which they are not likely to know the answer. Then you make a (wild) guess and whoever comes closest wins the point. But you also score points by betting on all the answers and the one you think is closest. Sometimes your answer will look pretty reasonable and sometimes it won't look to be even close to the correct answer. It is easy to understand and easy to play and it is fun.
customer_reviews.author: Mom and More

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Oh, Wows Galore!!
customer_reviews.text: Fun, fun, fun! This game rocks. Our entire family played- from age 10-82!! We love it. Great trivia questions and on average, you’re NOT going to know the answers, although some of us get close! You are amazed at the answers. Best purchase of the season!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy and Tim Louisville, KY

customer_reviews.title: Fun game but the brand new markers don't work!!
customer_reviews.text: Fun game to play with friends! It can get really competitive bidding which makes it a lot of fun! The markers that came with this brand new game were terrible though. All of them were dried out for our first use of it. I highly recommend they reduce the price of the game by $10 to allow you to go buy your own markers-- or include some expo markers!
customer_reviews.author: The Only Zeke

customer_reviews.title: This was THE game on Christmas Day!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this game based on Dave Ramsey radio show ad and written reviews. Got the family version because my youngest gets frustrated when she cannot compete in other games we have. This was the hit of the day on Christmas Day! From the grandparents to my 7 and 9 year olds, everyone had a great time playing it and my youngest was able to win a game! It moves quickly and is interesting. No one sits and waits for someone else to have a turn. The trivia itself may be a bit useless, but it is still very interesting information. Highly recommend for any type of group get together or just for family game night!!
customer_reviews.author: tdhsmh13

customer_reviews.title: New Casual Family Go-To Board Game!
customer_reviews.text: This is our new casual go-to family board game! It doesn’t take as long as other strategic board games, but requires a bit of strategy in making wagers for a win! We play in pairs so the whole family (age 5 on up) can enjoy it that way. Fun game!
customer_reviews.author: janejolene

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the entire family
customer_reviews.text: I saw this game while browsing at target and decided to order it off amazon since it was cheaper. It has been one of the best games I've ever purchased. Its extremely entertaining and easy for anyone to learn. I've played it with my family and I've even taken it to game nights with friends. I would highly recommend anyone who enjoys games to purchase wits and wagers.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Koenig

customer_reviews.title: SO. MUCH. FUN
customer_reviews.text: My family is huge into games, but it is tricky finding one that the grandparents, kids and grandkids can play together and all enjoy but holy cow! I have played this over and over and because it is complete guessing, it's anyone's game! SO. MUCH. FUN! and you learn random facts like: How many hours a day does a lion sleep? (... I won't tell you... because that is cheating... you will have to play the game yourself and find out!
customer_reviews.author: J. Gulia

customer_reviews.title: and everyone loved it. It was very easy to get out ...
customer_reviews.text: We played this over Christmas with people from 10-70, and everyone loved it. It was very easy to get out of the box and play quickly. I liked it because you didn't have to know the trivia questions to win, and it was a quick game - took about 15-20 minute to play so it was perfect - no one got tired of it, and we could play again if we wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Alayna

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for all ages... Kids may have the advantage!
customer_reviews.text: I played this with my nieces and nephews of diverse ages. This is fun playing single or on teams! The questions have only numbers as answers (1 to 1,000,000), and anyone can bet on anyone's answer. You win points when you choose the closest number without going over. Questions are similar to this... "How many times does a bee's wing beat in one second?" The answer surprised me, and the kids were closer. Adults don't have an advantage either because there are many contemporary questions that pertain to kids' interests... Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: JG Yahtzee

customer_reviews.title: Fun game and good gift
customer_reviews.text: My 20-year-old daughter asked for this as a Christmas present. Her and her friends have regular game nights and she’s played it before and really liked it. It seem to be a hit with her friends when she first took it to the last game night.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D from Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Love this game, trivia that isn't trivia.
customer_reviews.text: Love this game! We have played several times since we got it opened at Christmas. It rocks! The fun of it is you don't have to know the answers, you won't know most of them. It's hilarious. Some will make you wonder who sat around counting those answers up though... Not to mention the outside of this game offers a lifetime replacement of any part that goes missing from the game. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: DCA

customer_reviews.title: This a such a fun game. We play this at most family gatherings ...
customer_reviews.text: This a such a fun game. We play this at most family gatherings and it's suitable for all ages. You don't have to be a quiz master to win at this game. Game pieces are of good quality and glad that I went for the deluxe edition.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Fun facts - I must have been daydreaming in class!!
customer_reviews.text: Took it to a few large family holiday parties. Doesn’t matter how smart you think you are - it’s amazing how much you don’t know. We bought $50 with of scratchers to give to winners. Everyone had a blast!!!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Great Family Game
customer_reviews.text: Great game for everyone! You don't need to be trivia savvy to play. Believe it or not - it's educational too. You are guessing numbers, years, feet, inches - all of which can be a learning tool. It generates great conversation and laughs too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TwoLittleNinjas

customer_reviews.title: Family Fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to play as a family and it was a lot of fun. Pay attention, take your best guess and let the giggles begin. My kids love it when they are better guessers than the grown ups. Just a box of good, clean fun.
customer_reviews.author: Joelann

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the family
customer_reviews.text: Fun game and really entertained us during the Christmas break. I could see where you would begin to memorize questions after a while since there is only so many questions on the card. The only minor complaint I have is the 5 player package where we have a family of 6. Not sure why just 5 players.
customer_reviews.author: Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Wits and Wagers is a perfect family game!
customer_reviews.text: Wits and Wagers is now a family favorite! My husband and I have two kids (10 and 12) and we all love this game. We’ve had some of our kids’ friends over to play as well and it’s a huge hit! We will be getting the Vegas edition next!
customer_reviews.author: Shyla Hohlier

customer_reviews.title: This game has been great fun with the grandkids
customer_reviews.text: This game has been great fun with the grandkids. My 12, 10 and 6 year old played this game over and over. It is easy for my 6 yr but still fun and challenging for the 12 year old. We laughed, talked about the answer and the way we came up with our guess. They choose this game over being on their electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great game for families. When I retired and moved out west I gave my version of the game to my daughter and family. Once settled in my new retirement community I knee I had to buy the game again to have here because it is such a fun game for groups. So I guess you could say, the game is fun for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Viner

customer_reviews.title: Great a fun game
customer_reviews.text: This game was easy to learn, and great fun for everyone. The only negative was that the questions were all from 2012, but it was still fun. We plan on getting expansion questions.
customer_reviews.author: John Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Best Pure Trivia Game Around!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best game for trivia lovers around. Beats Trivial Pursuit. fun to play in groups or as single players. Really just a great Trivia Party Game!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for all ages.
customer_reviews.text: Very fun. First time to play. Played at Thanksgiving with family. Only problem was scoreboard was peeling at the top (it was fresh out of the box!). Everyone young and old were laughing and having fun. Great questions.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna L.

customer_reviews.title: fun game for a group of 4-6
customer_reviews.text: I didn't care for some of the questions that were in this game, I don't think we've gone through them all yet, but there were already some that we just skipped. As for the gameplay, I like that you can win by being the closest, or by correctly guessing which answer was the closest. The only thing I didn't like was the "Price is Right" rule of, "closest without going over". I frequently found that my guess was just barely over the real answer, and I found that to be extremely frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Pawa

customer_reviews.title: played it for the first time today
customer_reviews.text: And all the kids I got it for ( 4 kids 7 and up) loved it. The only thing is I wish there was a timer that came with it because as some kids turned in their answers other kids would let that determine their answers...a little copying if you will. And with kids that's annoying. but the game itself is fun for them. It's not MY kind of game (29 year old female) I like more open ended games like "say anything" where you can be creative and laugh. This is sort of game for facts and figures people. But the kids definitely really enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Sun

customer_reviews.title: Product needs quality control
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in plastic wrapper but one marker was completely dried out upon first use; could not write with it AT ALL. Slowed down game since two players had to share and this interferes with the time prior to wager.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for the whole family!
customer_reviews.text: This game is so fun and informative. It's like trivial pursuit but then you put 2 wagers on whoever's answer you think is right. That's the beauty of this game. You don't have to get the trivia questions right to win the game. You just have to make strategic bets. That's how my 10 year old beat a bunch of smart adults!!
customer_reviews.author: SloJo99

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for all!
customer_reviews.text: We laughed so much! Besides being fun, we learned a few things....how about that! It is a great item to gift to families.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Family Game Filled with Fun Facts
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific family game that almost all ages can play. My 3 year-old helps keep score or we give him a card and he guesses whatever numbers he wants. He often does better than the older buys just by luck! (Or he plays on one of our teams). It keeps them all interested. It is long enough to be fun without being too long. The questions usually are about things that no one really knows the answer for sure, so everyone has a pretty fair shot. Also, the younger kids can get points by "betting" on other people's cards, too. My 10 year-old is constantly begging to play.
customer_reviews.author: buckeyeohio

customer_reviews.title: A hit for game night!
customer_reviews.text: A really fun game for all ahes. This was a hit with Our family ages 22 and up but definitely could be played with young children too. It is fast paced, fun and easy to learn. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Marla C. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Great for a large group too!
customer_reviews.text: Nice game for multiple players! Challenging trivia questions! Fun! Easily adaptable to Christmas trivia game!
customer_reviews.author: Kay Davis

customer_reviews.title: SO fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game! It's easy to learn and very fun to play! Highly recommend for game nights! It's most fun if you play with at least 4 people
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: North Star Games Wits & Wagers Board Game | Deluxe Edition, Kid Friendly Party Game and Trivia
product_meta.description:
Edition:DeluxeDo you know the average number of pizza slices eaten by Americans each day? Of course not! That’s the fun. No one knows the answers, but everyone can take a guess. The felt betting mat and different payout odds will make you feel like a high roller. Get lucky and you’ll cheer like you hit the jackpot!

How to Play
1. Read a fun question...Everyone writes down a guess.
2. Place your bets... Which guess is closest?

Feeling confident? Bet on yourself.
Think others know better? Bet on them.
No idea? Bet on any guess and hope to get lucky.

Ages: 10+ | Players: 4+ | Play Time: 30 minutes.
feature_bullets: HISTORY’S MOST AWARD-WINNING PARTY GAME – Over 2 million games sold! The trivia game where you don’t need to know the answers to win!
EASY TO LEARN – Read a question. Just write down your best guess. Place your bets. Whose guess is closest to the correct answer? Collect your winnings!
DELUXE COMPONENTS - Casino-quality wagering chips, Crease-free felt mat, Deluxe dry-erase markers with erasers and Premium cardboard currency chips.
PLAY WITH MANY PLAYERS - Play with 4 to an unlimited number of players. Perfect to play in teams! Ages: 10+, 25 minutes to play
INCLUDES - 250 question, 28"x10" betting mat, 90 cardboard chips, 14 wager chips, 7 dry-erase pens, 7 dry-erase player boards, 1 sand timer, 1 rules manual

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,044 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
